data.title: Carl XVI Gustaf, King of Sweden
data.meta_description: Carl XVI Gustaf, King of Sweden (born Prince Carl Gustaf of Sweden on 14 January 1947) is the current reigning King of Sweden. He is the fifth child and only son of Prince Gustaf Adolf, Duke of Vasterbotten and Princess Sibylla of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha. He is also a member of the British Royal...
data.text:
Carl XVI Gustaf, King of Sweden (born Prince Carl Gustaf of Sweden on 14 January 1947) is the current reigning King of Sweden. He is the fifth child and only son of Prince Gustaf Adolf, Duke of Vasterbotten and Princess Sibylla of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha. He is also a member of the British Royal Family as the husband of his late wife Theresa, Princess Royal.

Life[]

Carl Gustaf's father died just twelve days after his birth in a plane crash in Denmark. Carl Gustaf thus became heir apparent to his grandfather, King Gustaf VI Adolf of Sweden, then Crown Prince of Sweden.

Marriage and Issue[]

Carl Gustaf first met his cousin, Theresa, Princess Royal, during a state visit to the United Kingdom in 1983. Carl Gustaf and Theresa's engagement was announced on 9 November 1984. The couple were married in Stockholm on 14 April 1985. Carl Gustaf and Theresa had four children: Ingrid, Carl Johan, Margaretha, and Amelie.

Carl Gustaf was widowed in November 2019, after Theresa passed away due to breast cancer.

Residences[]

Titles and Honours[]

1947-1950 Prince Carl Gustaf of Sweden

1950-1965 Carl Gustaf, Crown Prince of Sweden

1965-1974 Carl Gustaf, Crown Prince of Sweden, Duke of Jamtland

1974-present Carl XVI Gustaf, King of Sweden

National Honours[]

Order of the Seraphim (1965)

Order of the Sword (1974)

Order of the Polar Star (1974)

Order of Charles XIII (1974)

Order of Vasa (1965)

Foreign Honours[]

Order of the Garter (1983) (United Kingdom)

Royal Victorian Order (1985) (United Kingdom)
